etymologies: Middle English: variant of brief. In the musical sense, the term was originally used in a series where a long was of greater time value than a breve

definitions: a musical note having the time value of two semibreves or whole notes.
shortDefinitions: note, rarely used in modern music, having time value of two semibreves

definitions: a written or printed mark (˘) indicating a short or unstressed vowel.
shortDefinitions: written or printed mark (˘) indicating short or unstressed vowel

definitions: an authoritative letter from a pope or monarch.
shortDefinitions: authoritative letter from pope or monarch
